span.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: MS Sans Serif;
font-family: MS Sans Serif;
font-size: 13.5pt; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
span.a:
TO VIEW PHILADELPHIA E&T's
COVID-19
INFORMATION HUB
CLICK HERE

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: large; text-align: center; text-decoration-line: underline; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif;
font-size: 13.5pt; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

strong.span: Academic Plan for April 1, 2020 through June 16, 2020

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 13.5pt; color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 14px; color: black;

a.title: j
a.br: Click Here for the Full COVID-19 Plan-Revised March 30, 2020

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 14px; color: black;
span.a: Click Here for the Most Recent Memo Sent to Families on April 9, 2020

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 13.5pt; color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: black;

span.span: Philadelphia E&T is committed to the continuity of education for all of our students during this unprecedented set of circumstances related to the COVID-19 public health crisis. Effective, April 1, 2020, Philadelphia E&T will begin our remote learning program for the duration of the school closure.

span.style: font-size: 8pt; color: black;

br.br: Please note: These plans are subject to change based on further guidance from the U.S. Department of Education, Pennsylvania Department of Education or School District of Philadelphia.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: As part of our 1:1 Chromebook/iPad Program, every student in our school is assigned his/her own device. Through the inception of this program, every teacher in our school uses Schoology as a school-wide Learning Management System in our typical program, students should already be enrolled in their teachers’ Schoology courses . Our remote learning plan builds upon the infrastructure we already have in place. To participate in our online learning plan, students will need internet at home or access to a personal device that has internet access.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Students whose device was left in school should coordinate with the teacher who calls to arrange a pick up or delivery of school device. If you are unable to participate in our online learning plan, students can participate in our offline program by leaving a message at the school.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 13.5pt; color: black;

strong.span: Free Internet during the COVID-19 Crisis

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Students who do not have internet at home can apply for free internet through Comcast’s Internet Essentials Program by visiting www.internetessentials.com or by calling 1-855-INTERNET (1-855-8376). If you are unable to get internet at home or have other barriers preventing your online participation in remote learning, you can participate in our offline remote learning plan, which includes paper materials for you to receive from your preferred choice, pick-up or delivery.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 13.5pt; color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: During the week of March 24, 2020-March 27, 2020, teachers will make phone/email/text contact with each student’s family. This contact will be made in an attempt to speak to a student/parent/guardian to determine how the student will be participating in remote learning.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Special Education Teachers will call their caseloads to communicate with families regarding methods of support, IEP meeting dates, re-evaluations, waivers. The Special Education Department will make IEP or NOREP revisions as appropriate.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: School homeless liaison will make every effort to contact students who are already known to be homeless.

div.style: padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-style: none none solid; border-width: medium medium 1.5pt;

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: There are multiple ways we communicate with families: Our website www.petchs.org, USPS, social media accounts, email/text/phone blasts, personal phone/email contact, remind text messaging, and school email accounts/phone hotline/main school phone number.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 13.5pt; color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Please be sure that you are eating each day. If you need food, you can get multiple Grab and Go meals for the week at one of the school district sites near you on Thursday mornings between 9AM-12PM. The list is updated regularly, you can find by dialing 311 or visiting the site:

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 13.5pt; color: black;

div.style: padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-style: none none solid; border-width: medium medium 1.5pt;

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Please remember that you should still comply with our Acceptable Use Policy and that all school devices are expected to be treated with care and used appropriately. Click HERE to view the Acceptable Use Policies.

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 13.5pt; color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Students are required to sign in each day before 11AM to be counted present for the day. Sign in using link: https://forms.gle/YoWQTbW8utsmndGb6

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Staff will be checking student attendance and will contact students/families if they are absent via email, phone, etc.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Each academic week will begin on Wednesday. Teachers will post the week’s objectives, lessons, resources and assignments each week on their Schoology pages. Schoology access codes are listed HERE for all teachers, if you were not previously enrolled in the course.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Each lesson/assignment will be accommodated/modified for students with different needs. Special Education and ELL teachers are working with each academic department on the lessons/assignments.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Teachers will accept assignments using a variety of methods. They will be checking their email, Schoology pages and phones each day and will respond to your questions within 24 hours. Teachers will also have designated OFFICE HOURS which will be posted on their page to answer any questions you have in real time.

div.style: padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-style: none none solid; border-width: medium medium 1.5pt;

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
span.a: CLICK HERE to access our updated (4/22/20) “HOW TO GUIDE” for Remote Learning Online.

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 14pt; color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Although we acknowledge for some reasons it is impossible to have internet access for your school sponsored device, please make every effort to apply for the free internet in the home in an effort to maximize your contact to school staff/resources on a daily basis. Please contact Comcast’s Internet Essentials Program by visiting www.internetessentials.com or by calling 1-855-INTERNET (1-855-8376) to arrange for internet at home.

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Students are required to call in each day before 11AM to be counted present for the day. Students can call the hotline 1-267-322-1278 to report to school. Students can not text. They must leave a voice message.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Staff will be checking student attendance and will contact students/families if they are absent via email, phone, etc.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Each academic week will begin on Wednesday. Teachers will post the week’s objectives, lessons, resources and assignments each week on their Schoology pages. School staff will prepare paper packages for students using these materials for pick up at school or delivery to the home.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Each lesson/assignment will be accommodated/modified for students with different needs. Special Education and ELL teachers are working with each academic department on the lessons/assignments.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Teachers will accept assignments using a variety of methods.

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Essential School Staff will be in the school building on Wednesday mornings from 9AM to 11AM for picking up essential items left in school.

div.style: padding: 0in 0in 1pt; border-style: none none solid; border-width: medium medium 1.5pt;

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 14px;

em.span: *Subject to change based upon Governmental Stay-At-Home Policies*

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 14pt; color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;
font-size: 13px; color: black;
color: black;
color: black;
font-size: 14px;

em.span:
Ms. Tina Beck
beckt@petchs.org
267-514-1823 Extension 327
11th & 12th Grade Counselor/Homeless Liaison
Ms. Lauren Cramphorn
cramphornl@petchs.org
267-514-1823 Extension 222

span.style: color: black;
font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: If you need non-emergency guidance services, such as help with coping with this new school environment, having difficulty accessing/completing assignments, cyber bullying, personal issues, college guidance, or assistance due to a lack of housing please contact your counselor listed below. For all emergencies, call 911. Any student who is experiencing homeless or has been displaced from their current living arrangement are urged to contact our Homeless Liaison, Ms. Lauren Cramphorn directly or call the School Hotline 1-267-322-1278.

div.style: padding: 0in 0in 31pt; border-style: none none solid; border-width: medium medium 1.5pt;

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Every student's IEP will be reviewed by their classroom teachers and the Special Education Department. Accommodations/Modifications will be done in advance of the assignment of lessons. Communication will be made to each students' parents/guardians to review placements, IEP goals, accommodations/modifications and upcoming meeting dates. There will be special virtual/telephonic support sessions for students who need extra assistance with this new modality of learning through this public health crisis.

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 11pt; color: black;

em.span:
For Support or More Information:
Contact: Ms. Leigh Ann Wilson
Director of Special Education
wilsonl@petchs.org
267-514-1823 Extension 295

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
color: black;

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Teachers will use different tools to help with translation services for communication, lessons and assignments. Both our school website and Schoology sites allow users to change the language throughout using a feature on each site’s toolbar. Our ESL team will support teachers to continue to offer modifications throughout lessons/assignments.

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

span.style: font-family: MS Sans Serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 11pt; color: black;

em.span:
For Support or More Information
Contact: Ms. Rosemarie DeFelice, Head of Academics
defelicer@petchs.org
267-514-1823 Extension 221

p.style: padding: 0in; border-style: none; border-width: medium; border-image: none 100% / 1 / 0 stretch;

p.span: At this time, there has not been an official decision made regarding the status of Senior Events including Prom and Graduation. An announcement will be made on April 30, 2020. The date of the announcement has been pushed back due to our awaiting further information from our governing Board and select vendors.
